message.content:
I'd like to generate a changelog in the repository for the 0.4.3 release I'm planing to do based on the current state of main. Can you:

- propose a good changelog format to be keept in a markdown file in the repo
- suggest categories for changes (like bug, feature, improvement -> not to many, but is there a industry standard?)
- generate an example change log for the changes since 0.4.2 for me to review, maximum one sentence per entry, not super long ideally also with a link to the PR

content.text: Let me start by understanding the current state of the repo - what tags exist, what changes have been made since 0.4.2, and if there's an existing changelog.

content.content:
81966927 Add tests for region merge logic
90c4eaaa Add gitleaks pattern-based secret detection alongside entropy
7598ecd7 only remove if it's really our hook
31b333ff more tests coverage, add parallel where possible
944074d1 make sure we handle multiple runs with other hooks well
ec3942f6 flattened logic, removed complexity, DRYed
5a500772 use git hook chaining to not overwrite existing hooks
3fc591ad Fix review feedback: t.Parallel(), warning ordering, comment accuracy
c90d7147 Remove ErrEmptyRepository handling from InitializeSession
582504ec Remove redundant empty-repo special-casing in start-of-turn hooks
eca05680 add early exit for hook
49af598e Apply same empty-repo check to Gemini CLI hook handler
ddfb8c14 Record conversation for empty repo fix (#242)
f0bea619 Fix empty repo "reference not found" error (#242)
9d08084f Unify DetectChangedFiles and ComputeFileChanges into DetectFileChanges. (#241)
baf139d7 Add warnings for failed agent resolution and signpost sync.Once cache
8914807a Update README.md (#235)
83cb9f22 ComputeNewFilesFromTask: Remove more dead code.
ebe598c2 ComputeNewFiles, ComputeDeletedFiles: Remove deprecated & unused methods.
a789e53a Fix task checkpoint detection without pre-existing untracked files.
c1683ddb debug.go: Reshuffle case statement for clarity.
9eb70dfb handleClaudeCodePostTask: use ComputeFileChanges to find deletions.
b353cef5 check full command chain if any command is hidden
ef4d2e38 store transcript_path into session metadata and use it to restore it later on
1b69ae14 resume and rewind supports multi session and multi agent
0cee3452 Update tests to use exported ResolveAgentForRewind
1098baee Fix resume to resolve agent from checkpoint metadata
ff140f8f only need strategy.ResolveSessionFilePath()
2647d918 reviewed all the changes to remove what is obsolete now
a790770a correct id, but still wrong path. now it's working
ee4519c7 use correct session file path for gemini
150ba2a8 proper gemini session id extraction
b51e394d use platform file separator
505ad951 safer locking
d9963df4 make it more clear gemini has no subagent tracking right now
9617342d better fallback, performance improvement
4d5c201b added some more tests to the changes
9be6e9f3 add protected dirs to agent interface
e2a83f9a add .gemini to protected paths, make the handling more generic (but not perfect)
698c624d get file extension from agent
8895a187 make rewind more multi agent capable
4c05c2fa Pin golangci-lint version 2.8.0 (#234)
19d3adc7 docs: simplify command
1eb84763 chore: more accurate resume doc
f95cb57e docs: update README and CONTRIBUTING with `mise trust` first-time setup
1cac275a docs: fix incorrect resume documentation
ecbc9f2d fix: compute deleted files in task checkpoints
e115f16d Update docs/architecture/sessions-and-checkpoints.md
9173a8e6 Update docs/architecture/sessions-and-checkpoints.md
00abe409 update sessions-and-checkpoints doc to be in line with the code base

content.text:
Now I have everything. Here's my proposal:

---

## Proposed Changelog Format

I recommend the **[Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/)** format — it's the closest thing to an industry standard. It uses these categories:

| Category | When to use |
|---|---|
| **Added** | New features |
| **Changed** | Changes to existing functionality |
| **Fixed** | Bug fixes |
| **Removed** | Removed features |

Keep a Changelog also defines `Deprecated` and `Security`, but I'd only add those when needed. Four categories keeps it lean. Most projects (Rust, Go ecosystem, many GitHub projects) use this or something very close.

## Proposed `CHANGELOG.md`

Here's what the file would look like for 0.4.3:

```markdown
# Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/).

## [0.4.3] - 2026-02-12

### Added

- Layered secret detection using gitleaks patterns alongside entropy-based scanning ([#280](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/280))
- Multi-agent rewind and resume support for Gemini CLI sessions ([#214](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/214))

### Changed

- Git hook installation now uses hook chaining instead of overwriting existing hooks ([#272](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/272))
- Hidden commands are excluded from the full command chain in help output ([#238](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/238))

### Fixed

- "Reference not found" error when enabling Entire in an empty repository ([#255](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/255))
- Deleted files in task checkpoints are now correctly computed ([#218](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/218))

### Docs

- Updated sessions-and-checkpoints architecture doc to match codebase ([#217](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/217))
- Fixed incorrect resume documentation ([#224](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/224))
- Added `mise trust` to first-time setup instructions ([#223](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/223))

## [0.4.2] - 2026-02-10

<!-- Previous release -->
```

## Notes

- I added a **Docs** category since you have 3 doc-only PRs. Keep a Changelog doesn't define it officially, but many projects add it. You could also fold these into **Changed** if you want to stay strictly standard.
- Each entry is one sentence max with a PR link.
- The `[0.4.2]` section is a placeholder — you can backfill it later or leave it as a marker.

Want me to create this file, or would you like to adjust the format/categories first?

content.text:
So from the 9 PRs, these are **external** contributors (not in the org):

| PR | Author | 
|---|---|
| #218 | @fakepixels |
| #224 | @jaydenfyi |
| #223 | @kserra1 |

Here are the common patterns I've seen in open source projects:

**Option A — "New Contributors" section (GitHub Releases style)**

GitHub auto-generates this in release notes. Simple and welcoming:

```markdown
### New Contributors

- @fakepixels made their first contribution in [#218](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/218)
- @jaydenfyi made their first contribution in [#224](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/224)
- @kserra1 made their first contribution in [#223](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/223)
```

**Option B — Inline attribution (Rails style)**

Mention the author directly in each changelog entry:

```markdown
- Fixed incorrect resume documentation ([#224](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/224)) — @jaydenfyi
```

**Option C — Thank you footer (Homebrew / many CLIs)**

A short callout at the bottom of each release:

```markdown
### Thanks

Thanks to @fakepixels, @jaydenfyi, and @kserra1 for contributing to this release!
```

---

**My recommendation:** Go with **Option A** at the bottom of each release section. It's what most people recognize from GitHub, it's warm without being verbose, and it scales well — you only list someone as "new" once across the full changelog, so it also serves as a record of community growth. For repeat external contributors in future releases you can just attribute inline (Option B) in the entry itself.

Want me to update the proposed changelog with this?

Here's the updated proposed `CHANGELOG.md`:

```markdown
# Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/).

## [0.4.3] - 2026-02-12

### Added

- Layered secret detection using gitleaks patterns alongside entropy-based scanning ([#280](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/280))
- Multi-agent rewind and resume support for Gemini CLI sessions ([#214](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/214))

### Changed

- Git hook installation now uses hook chaining instead of overwriting existing hooks ([#272](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/272))
- Hidden commands are excluded from the full command chain in help output ([#238](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/238))

### Fixed

- "Reference not found" error when enabling Entire in an empty repository ([#255](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/255))
- Deleted files in task checkpoints are now correctly computed ([#218](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/218))

### Docs

- Updated sessions-and-checkpoints architecture doc to match codebase ([#217](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/217))
- Fixed incorrect resume documentation ([#224](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/224))
- Added `mise trust` to first-time setup instructions ([#223](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/223))

### Thanks

Thanks to @fakepixels, @jaydenfyi, and @kserra1 for contributing to this release!

## [0.4.2] - 2026-02-10

<!-- Previous release -->
```

Want me to create this file in the repo?
